text.name: sys_description
text.text: At the dawn of the 32 bit era, Sega had 2 projects, Saturn in Japan and Neptune in the USA. It was the Saturn project that won, and in order not to lose their job, Sega of America released the 32X. An extension for the Megadrive, plugged into the cartridge port. It adds 256 KB of RAM, a 32-bit processor at 23 Mhz which multiplies its power by 40, for a rendering of 50 thousand polygons second in mapped 3D, a display in 32 thousand colors, effects of rotation, distortion and zoom of Sprite. The exit of Saturn being too close, only 34 plays left on cartridge and 6 others on CD.
